import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
from urllib.parse import urljoin
from pyspark.sql import Row

BASE_URL = "https://www.medstat.dk"
PAGE_URL = "https://www.medstat.dk/da/download/"
ADLS_STAGING = "abfss://group3fpfilesystem@group3fpadls.dfs.core.windows.net/staging/"
ADLS_DIR = ADLS_STAGING + "denmark_medicine/"

# Fetch the page
response = requests.get(PAGE_URL)
response.raise_for_status()
soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, "html.parser")

# Loop over links
for link in soup.find_all("a", href=True):
    href = link["href"]
    text = link.get_text(strip=True)
    
    if href.startswith("/da/download/file/") and "atc_code_data" in text:
        file_url = urljoin(BASE_URL, href)
        filename = text  # e.g. "1996_atc_code_data.txt"

        print(f"Downloading {filename}", end="\r", flush=True)
        file_response = requests.get(file_url)
        file_response.raise_for_status()
        
        file_bytes = file_response.content
        lines = file_bytes.decode("utf-8").splitlines()
        df = spark.createDataFrame([Row(value=line) for line in lines])

        # Special case for "atc_code_text.txt"
        if filename == "atc_code_text.txt":
            output_path = ADLS_STAGING + filename
        else:
            output_path = ADLS_DIR + filename

        (df.write.mode("overwrite")
           .text(output_path))
